sources.title: Angels One Five (1952)
sources.description: "Angels One Five" is a 1952 British war film directed by George More O'Ferrall and is notable for being the first British post-war film to depict the Battle of Britain. The film is based on Pelham Groom's book "What Are Your Angels Now?" and features a cast that includes Jack Hawkins, Michael Denison, Dulcie Gray, and John Gregson. The story follows Pilot Officer T.B. "Septic" Baird, who arrives at a front-line RAF squadron during the Battle of Britain. After a rough start, he must navigate the challenges of military life, impress his superiors, and survive intense aerial combat. The film captures the struggles and camaraderie of pilots and ground crew during this critical period in World War II.

metadata.Plot: 'Septic' Baird has just joined a front line RAF squadron at the height of the Battle of Britain. This is the story of "The Few" and how they managed to fight off the might of the Luftwaffe despite overwhelming German air power.
metadata.Actors: Jack Hawkins, Michael Denison, Andrew Osborn
